bio:treatment.description: Stems 0.2–1(–1.5) dm. Leaves green; long hairs of petioles 1–2(–3) mm; leaflets: hairs common, rarely dense. Flowers 1–5; filaments 2–3 mm; carpels 5–10, styles (2–)2.5–3 mm. Achenes 2 mm, smooth.
Rocky openings, in mixed conifer forests;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety chiricahuensis is known only from the Chiricahua Mountains (Cochise County). It differs from the typical variety in being less densely hairy, with somewhat longer and coarser hairs and larger achenes. It is also less likely to be found rooted in outcrops, favoring rocky flats.
